alert.note: Alert for Spencer; Warrick (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 03 at 11:12AM EST until March 03 at 2:00PM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON FOR SPENCER, WARRICK, DAVIESS, HOPKINS, MCLEAN AND WEBSTER COUNTIES... At 1012 AM CST, Thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area were becoming more scattered. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area with additional storms this afternoon. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Evansville, Owensboro, Madisonville, Boonville, Newburgh, Providence, Dawson Springs, and Calhoun. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
